alternatives.transcript: a murder that stunned even veteran detectives it was a nasty nasty crimes and the crime that offers few clues there were no signs of any struggle or fight versus a sex crime by a jilted lover her body was positioned in a way that was very sexually suggestive it's hard to imagine anybody's capable of something like this until one man's words revealed a twisted motive and chiller with a bizarre past
this
Jacksonville Florida with its warm sandy beaches in subtropical climate was the perfect place for 25 year old Corey Parker to attend college
she liked it a lot better than the cold winters of her home town of Rochester New York
Cory was beautiful she's very tall she had a presence about her some of our best times together was a girls night in you know rent movies and go hang out in the house

Laurie worked her way through college as a waitress during the thanksgiving holiday ever junior year she didn't show up for work so her fellow employees were concerned they thought immediately that something was wrong
so the manager or director one of the cooks to go by her apartment to check on
her apartment door was locked
a worker looked inside
you saw her body on the bed covered in blood
this crime scene was one of the worst that this county has ever seen in terms of its just gruesome S.
there was blood all over her bedroom all over her body almost as if it had been painted on her
the scene appeared to be staged Corey's body was positioned in a way that was very sexually suggestive
she was nude her her legs were spread apart there's every indication that there was a sexual motive to this crime
interestingly the autopsy found no evidence of sexual assault
for Parker was stabbed 101 times of those 101 stab wounds I believe 54 postmortem
overkill does indicate investigators a relationship between victim and perpetrator
police learned that the night before her murder Corey spent the night at a local bar with friends witnesses said she left around 1:00 AM
the closed Corey wore to the bar folded neatly at the bottom of her bed
we also know that she had prepared herself for bed and crawled into her bed so we know that she wasn't attacked until after she was in bed so either he was waiting in her bedroom closet
or he let himself into the apartment
investigators found a gold plated Zippo lighter in Cory's bedroom although Cory smoked none of her friends recognized
investigators dusted the lighter for fingerprints but none were found it became apparent that there was no way that that was poor Parkers later
inside the kitchen of Cory's apartment police found
bloodstain on the kitchen counter next to the sink
on the windowsill above the sink both inside and outside
this led police to believe the killer entered and exited the apartment through the kitchen window the reason we believe the killer didn't go out the door was because of the light that was outside
the kitchen window offered the suspect a way to you both get in and out of the apartment without being eliminated

Corey's phone records revealed that a former co worker 27 year old Eric Jones had been calling her repeatedly before her death she had been asking Corey out for some time she had been telling him no Chloe's at the restaurant told us that he had an obsession or an infatuation with her and was continuously talking to or when she come to work or trying to ask her out
Jones said no criminal record

but acted bizarrely when interviewed by police not only did he have a history of mental illness by his own admission but he told police officers that he had fantasies about raping and killing women which clearly jumped out at law enforcement he described sexual fantasies that he had about Corey some somewhere fairly violent

he even told investigators how he would have murdered Corey had he been given the chance he described how he would have slit her throat early in the early in the murder so that she can scream for help
and that description was similar enough to how she was really killed that it again raised police suspicions
the medical examiner who performed Corey Parker's autopsy found no signs of sexual assault
but Corey had been stabbed over 100 times
there were numerous defensive wounds on her hands and arms proving
there had been an intense struggle

our theory was that Corey Parker fought for her life in order to prevent a sexual assault investigators found several foreign hairs in corrie's hands one had an intact route the fact that there had written on it and was not from her would allow you to at least presume that at here had to be attained forcefully DNA testing revealed the blood in the kitchen came from the same person as the hair in Cory's hand surprisingly this DNA did not match the prime suspect Eric Jones Cory's co worker despite his bizarre behavior I think it's fair to say was mentally unstable at this time and while prescribed medication to
control his mental illness he was not taking it and so I think at the time that he gave the statements he was mentally unstable
the DNA from Corey's apartment did not match any of the DNA profiles in either the state or national criminal databases
in the search for Corey Parker's killer investigators discovered that she had just started dating someone new
his name was David wilt
but it didn't take long for investigators to eliminate him as a suspect
he was out of state his parents house for thanksgiving and so you know had a very solid alibi
investigators interviewed everyone Corey spoke with at the Ritz bar on the night of her murder
most of the people Cory saw that night left the bar before she did
but one friend Tiffany Smith stayed with Cory until one in the morning
Tiffany told police they both left the bar at the same time in their own cars and went their separate ways but Tiffany told friends that wasn't the only contact she had with Corey that night

she said she called Corey from her cell phone around 2:00 AM and Cory answered the phone she said when Cory answered the phone at Cory was asleep and she asked her what she was doing Corey said I'm sleeping

Tiffany also told friends she drove the car is apartment around 4:00 AM and knocked on her door but no one answered so she left her statement that she went by Cory's house puts her at the crime scene during the time that Corey could possibly been killed and that added to that suspicion that she could possibly be involved
but when investigators checked Tiffany's cell phone records they made a startling discovery Tiffany didn't call Corey after they left the Ritz bar
obviously investigators were curious as to why she would say that she called in actually spoken with Corey when it wasn't true
but why would any make up a story like that everybody was talking about the possibility that maybe she was sexually interested in Corey
Tiffany mentioned to me and just a very casual conversation that she had been bi curious
Tiffany had a real true affection for Corey

in addition to finish told friends things about the crime scene that had not been released to the general public she was describing the state of the victim's body and the scene without having been privy to either photographs or walk through of the scene they they thought it was certainly suspicious I thought it was really strange that she would have any idea of how Corey had been killed
Tiffany denied any involvement in the murder but when asked to provide a DNA sample she refused
the fact that she did not willingly give up DNA or hair samples with police to believe she had something to hide
even though Corey Parker's friend Tiffany Smith insisted she had nothing to do with Corey C. murder she made on the truthful statements about her activities on the night of the murder
she also refused to provide a DNA sample
she actually put herself at the crime scene and one of her statements
but scientists found a surprising piece of information in the blood evidence left by the killer
they found the tell tale Y. chromosome a Y. chromosome is present

only in the man we did develop a male profile from this particular sample which was a blood sample from a point of entry or exit into the apartment we are optimistic that this could be from the suspect
so Tiffany was eliminated as a suspect they believed that Tiffany was saying things to kind of injector softening the best occasion to make her seem more important than she was
investigators believe Tiffany learned details of the crime scene from a friend who worked on the emergency crew
police were forced to consider the possibility that Carrey's murder was a random act perpetrated by a man with an uncontrollable hatred for women
eventually police perform DNA tests on 38 man co workers fellow students former boyfriends with no success
I was very concerned that they would never solve the case and what I learned from watching other crimes is that the longer it goes on the less likely it is to solve a crime

18 months passed and police continue to work the case pouring through the file re reading the police interviews to generate new leads police offered a reward for any new evidence which would lead to a conviction and it generated a lead

some employees of a local steak house a few miles from Corey Parker's apartment called police to report that a co worker Robert Danny behaves suspiciously after Cory's murder you just seem to be upset I was crying had come into this restaurant one day and told him that his child had been killed in an automobile accident in Texas and that he needed to get back home Denny's co workers responded generously by raising money so he could return to Texas to attend his son's funeral after collecting that money the owner of the restaurant went over to give the money to a sister when he was told that Robert many did not have a son in that story was fabricated
and there was something else about Robert Downey he lived in the same complex as Corey Parker with a direct line of sight into her apartment
Robert Denny told some co workers about this woman that lived in an apartment below him and he began to talk about how he would watch her
and even went so far to graphically described that he would masturbate while watching her
when police decided to question Danny again his sister told police that he had left the area she had actually kicked him out of the home she shared with her husband

because of his odd behavior staying up all hours of the night his what she described as an addiction to pornography she told one law enforcement officer that she had woken him looking over her bed and staring at her then police learned another disturbing piece of information Robert Downey's older brother was serving a life sentence in Texas for stabbing a woman 97 times

core Parker was stabbed 101 time what are the chances of 2 young men coming out of the same family committing such heinous heinous and atrocious murders and did you get that idea from his brother was trying to emulate his brother
18 months after Corey Parker's murder investigators found Robert Downey 800 miles away in Maryland where he was living with a 52 year old married woman
Robert Downey had struck up an email relationship with a married woman and eventually had convinced her to let him come up there and live with her and her husband
he and this woman had a sexual relationship right under the house business

when police questioned and they they told him they were investigating his possible involvement in a different crime hoping he'd let down his guard they told him that they were investigating a potential allegation that he had been involved in a fight in Easton Maryland which they thought that he would voluntarily give his DNA to prove that he had not been involved in the fight and we were not leaving Houston Maryland to we got this DNA
this proved to be harder than investigators anticipated
Danny smoke during his interrogation
always made sure to keep the cigarette butts detectives offered him a bottle of water
but he would talk to

we ask him does with the letter into the envelope and seal the envelopes he refused to seal the envelopes and at that point basically told us look you've tried 3 times to get my saliva on something first the cigarette but then the water bottle and now the envelopes and seal it yourself is there anything else you know I can do for you
so investigators put Danny under surveillance at his home and at the computer store where he worked
he took a cigarette break every 45 minutes
but was careful to keep the evidence
when he smoked a cigarette he would put out the fire and then the box in his pocket so they cannot be collected
2 days passed and investigators finally got a break
just after a brief rain storm Dani came outside to smoke
but this time he did something different

he walked around and then all of a sudden began spitting on the sidewalk not once not twice but 6 times because of the rain saliva was sitting on top of the rain water making it easy to collect and the barrier help reduce contamination it was very easy to designate where it was at that point on is the same as testing for hair or blood stains are seen missing
the results left no doubt
the unknown DNA from Corey Parker's apartment belonged to Robert and
the fact that he denied ever having been in her apartment made it this evidence all the more incriminating
and there was one other piece of evidence that implicated
the gold plated lighter found in Cory's bedroom he said it wasn't his
but a former girlfriend told police it was his lecture
she was able to identify the emblem on it she was positive that was his minor
prosecutors believe Robert Downey was obsessed with this beautiful neighbor Corey Parker
and monitored her comings and goings he also looked inside her apartment whenever he cooked
prosecutors believe Danny saw Corey get ready to go with their friends on the night before thanksgiving
then armed with a knife
wearing gloves he entered Cory's apartment through the kitchen window
the evidence suggests he hid somewhere possibly in her closet and waited for her to return
Corey had no hint that anyone was inside
and went to bed
that's when Danny attack

in the process she pulled out some of his hair which contained his DNA
his lighter can slip from his pocket during the struggle
case diameter repeatedly
at some point he cut himself and bled inside his glove tapped
as he left the apartment through the kitchen window
he left a blood smear on the window sill
providing his DNA
Robert Downey went on trial for first degree murder

the jury deliberated for 45 minutes we the jury find the defendant guilty of murder in the first degree as charged in the indictment we the jury further find that the killing was done with premeditation since he was only 17 years old a minor when he committed the crime
Danny was sentenced to life in prison without parole
Robert Downey is a hard person to understand there was obviously some dysfunction and his family that
